documentType: arrest warrant and prisoner processing forms
summary: This document set includes the arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein issued on July 2, 2019, and associated US Marshals Service prisoner processing forms from the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn. It details the charges against Epstein and standard intake procedures following his arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual named in the arrest warrant for sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors, and the subject of the prisoner processing forms.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: The judge who signed the arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Arrest Warrant Issued for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A United States magistrate judge issued an arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.

keyFacts: An arrest warrant was issued for Jeffrey Epstein on July 2, 2019, by Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses.
Epstein was charged with sex trafficking conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371) and sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. §§ 1591(a), (b)(2), and (2)).
The documents show he was processed as a prisoner at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.
The forms are standard US Marshals Service intake documents, indicating a formal federal arrest and detention process.
The case number is listed as 19Cr 490 in the Southern District of New York.
